intro: Bourreria exsucca, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a short stature, often reaching only a few centimeters in height, and produces pale yellow or greenish flowers. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-tolerant gardens.
